vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-nested-if
vulnerability_findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function
vulnerability_findings.message: LibEIP712.hashEIP712Message (LibSwaprateOrder.sol#42-57) is declared view but contains assembly code

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
LibEIP712.hashEIP712Message uses assembly (LibSwaprateOrder.sol#42-57)
	- LibSwaprateOrder.sol#45-55

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
LibSwaprateOrder.retrieveAddress uses assembly (LibSwaprateOrder.sol#251-278)
	- LibSwaprateOrder.sol#260-264

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in LibSwaprateOrder.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.5.4']
	- LibSwaprateOrder.sol#3 declares pragma solidity^0.5.4
	- LibSwaprateOrder.sol#62 declares pragma solidity^0.5.4
	- LibSwaprateOrder.sol#63 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in LibSwaprateOrder.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.5.4 (LibSwaprateOrder.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.4 (LibSwaprateOrder.sol#62): it allows old versions
